title: New Hampshire man charged with burning, beating son, 7, to death
description: Murtadah Mohammad of New Hampshire has been charged with second-degree murder in connection with the death of his seven-year-old son, Jaevion Riley.

description: Every Fourth of July party requires good, patriotic music to celebrate the nation. These songs will make great addition to your July 4th playlist.

title: New Mexico authorities search for vandals who trashed a mosque multiple times over recent weeks
description: Authorities in New Mexico are investigating a case where a mosque was vandalized multiple times over recent weeks. The vandals ripped up a Quran and poured beer on it.

title: Alex Palou notches third consecutive victory at Mid-Ohio
description: Alex Palou continued his dominant run with his third straight win at Mid-Ohio and fourth win in his last five races as he continues to extend his points lead.

title: Ashley Brewer reveals ESPN laid her off days before wedding
description: Ashley Brewer revealed on Sunday she was laid off from ESPN with her wedding around the corner. Brewer made the revelation on TikTok as she prepares to marry Frank Kaminsky.

title: Max Verstappen dominates at Austrian Grand Prix, continues march toward third straight world title
description: Reigning Formula One champion Max Verstappen won in dominant fashion on Sunday at the Austrian Grand Prix as he continues his march towards a third straight world title.

title: Netflix quietly cancels 'anti-racist' video project started after George Floyd, report says
description: Netflix quietly squashed an anti-racist project in the works after companies faced backlash from conservatives over woke content, according to a recent report.

title: UN body discusses potential for deep sea mining, permits may be coming soon
description: The United Nations body that regulates the ocean floor is discussing the potential for deep sea mining. The possibility of issuing permits is being discussed

title: 5.4 magnitude quake shakes Indonesia’s easternmost province Papua, no casualties immediately reported
description: Indonesia’s Papua was struck by an earthquake with a magnitude of 5.4. There were no immediate reports of serious casualties or damage, but aftershocks may still occur.

title: Army major, junior officer killed during ambush in southwestern Pakistan
description: A junior officer and an army major were killed during a search operation in southwestern Pakistan. Another soldier was injured in the attack.

title: Oregon father of 5 dies after falling from Multnomah Falls trail: report
description: A father of five from Beaverton, Oregon, died after falling more than 100 feet along the Multnomah Falls trail outside of Portland, police say.

title: Damian Lillard addresses concerns about trade request from Trail Blazers
description: Trail Blazers star Damian Lillard addressed concerns about him wanting out of the organization as fans appeared to be angry with him for not staying through another rebuild.

title: Israel deploys thousands of troops, drones in attack on Jenin stronghold in terrorism 'hotspot'
description: Israeli drones struck targets at a militant stronghold in the West Bank early Monday, and thousands of troops were deployed in the area.

title: United Nations urges maritime countries to agree on a strategy to hit net-zero shipping emissions by 2050
description: Antonio Guterres, the head of the United Nations, is calling for maritime countries to create a plan to reduce its climate-harming shipping emissions to net zero by 2050.

title: New Greek lawmakers sworn in following election victory for conservative party
description: Greece's conservative Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis won in a landslide in the country's June 25 election. On July 3, 2023, the country swore in new lawmakers.

title: 3 plead guilty in connection to burglary ring that stole art, other items including Pollock, Warhol
description: Three people have pleaded guilty in connection with a burglary ring that stole artwork, sports memorabilia, and other items over two decades in Pennsylvania.

title: 10 states plan to sue US Environmental Protection Agency over standards for residential wood-burning stoves
description: Ten attorney generals from states across the U.S. plan to sue the Environmental Protection Agency regarding the standards for residential wood-burning stoves.

title: Shania Twain wipes out onstage during Chicago concert
description: Shania Twain slipped on stage while performing in Chicago during her "Queen of Me" tour. She remained on the floor for a few moments before continuing her song.

title: Downtown Tokyo building explosion causes 4 injuries
description: Windows shattered and smoke spewed after a blast occurred at a building in the commercial district of Shimbashi in Tokyo, Japan. Four people were also injured.

title: Suspects wanted after D.C. businesses hit with explosive devices, Molotov cocktail: police
description: Police in Washington, D.C., say they are seeking a suspect after three local businesses were hit with explosive devices and a Molotov cocktail-style device.

title: MSNBC's Joy Reid admits affirmative action got her into Harvard
description: MSNBC anchor Joy Reid described how affirmative action helped her to attend Harvard while attacking the Supreme Court decision's to strike it down.

title: Texas man who vanished 8 years ago while walking dogs is found safe
description: The Texas Center for the Missing says 26-year-old Rudy Farias, who was last seen walking his dogs in Houston in 2015, has been found safe.

title: Excessive heat warnings remain in place across US, expected to last at least through Monday
description: Many states across the U.S. delt with extremely high temperatures over the weekend. Excessive heat warnings are expected to remain in place at least through Monday.

title: WATCH: Brewery leak turns famously crystal-clear sea water a 'gruesome' color
description: U.S. health authorities have deemed the chemical propylene glycol, used in food dye and as an ingredient in coolant, as "generally recognized as safe."

title: You don’t need a college degree for every job. Employers are wising up
description: The concept of degree inflation has meant more jobs have required college degrees. There's a big problem with that, 62% of adults don't have a bachelor’s degree.

title: Why Jim Caviezel's new film is personal to a man of faith: 'The devil owns the fence'
description: Jim Caviezel stars in "The Sound of Freedom," about the evils of human trafficking — and shared his Christian beliefs in an interview with "Lighthouse Faith" podcast's Lauren Green.

title: North Dakota education officials worried about losing revenue due to implications of new MN free tuition plan
description: Education officials in North Dakota are worried about losing revenue in 2024 due to the "catastrophic implications" of Minnesota's new free tuition plan.

title: WNBA champ Natasha Cloud expands on America criticism after calling country 'trash'
description: WNBA champion Natasha Cloud on Saturday expanded on what she meant when she tweeted that "our country is trash in so many ways." She had words for all critics.

title: Bill Maher says he is happy to lose 'super woke' fans: 'Don’t let the door hit you in the a--'
description: Bill Maher said his criticism of cancel culture has cost him a number of 'super woke' fans, a result which he is happy with considering they were 'no fun to begin with.'

title: Fan falls from Citi Field seats to outfield warning track during Mets-Giants game
description: A fan at Citi Field fell from the stands to the warning track in the outfield on Sunday night as the New York Mets took on the San Francisco Giants.

title: Georgia mother charged after body of 7-year-old daughter found decaying in closet
description: A Georgia mother was arrested after police discovered the body of her 7-year-old daughter decaying in the closet of a vacant apartment in DeKalb County.

title: Colleges begin to use vending machines to sell morning-after pill as more states restrict abortion
description: As abortion restrictions become more common in the United States, college campuses are using vending machines to sell the morning-after pill and pregnancy tests.

title: Ailing Thai elephant returns home from Sri Lanka after years of possible neglect, abuse
description: An ailing elephant in Sri Lanka has returned home to Thailand for medical treatment following allegations that the elephant was in bad health due to years of abuse and hard labor.

title: IL businessman convicted of price-gouging N95 masks early in pandemic
description: Krikor Topouzian, a businessman from Illinois, has been convicted of price-gouging N95 masks in the early weeks of the pandemic. Topouzian faces up to a year in prison.

title: Heavy flooding relieves China from sweltering heat, but displaces over 10,000 residents
description: While recent flooding has helped moderate China’s scorching temperatures, more than 10,000 residents were displaced in the province of Hunan.

title: Psaki attempts to scare Muslim parents from opposing transgender ideology in schools: GOP 'trying to recruit'
description: Ismail Royer of the Religious Freedom Institute says 'Inside with Jen Psaki' segment is part of the left's agenda to scare Muslims into accepting indoctrination.

title: Sandra Bullock's 'utterly terrifying' stalking incident highlighted in new TMZ documentary on Fox Nation
description: Award-winning actress Sandra Bullock's heart-stopping moment a stalker broke into her home is revisited in TMZ's new 'Stalkers in Hollywood' series, available to stream on Fox Nation.

title: Philly mayor under scrutiny as city resists push to reinvestigate 'suicide' of woman stabbed 20 times
description: Philadelphia leaders have resisted appeals from 27-year-old teacher Ellen Greenberg's family to have her gruesome stabbing death reviewed for more than a decade.

title: Ryan Mallett's girlfriend posts heartbreaking tribute to late QB: 'I’m so sorry I couldn’t save you'
description: Ryan Mallett's girlfriend, Madison Carter, posted a touching tribute to the late quarterback on her Facebook page. Mallett drowned off the coast of Florida last week.

title: American cities ditch July 4th tradition, veterans get blunt this Independence Day and more top headlines
description: American cities ditch July 4th tradition, veterans get blunt this Independence Day and more top headlines

title: Olivia Dunne dishes on age range of autograph seekers after viral College World Series moment
description: Olivia Dunne talked about the viral moment in the College World Series where she was signing an autograph for an older man. She talked about the age range of the seekers.

title: Larry Elder warns Dems kicking VP Harris to curb could spell doom for party in 2024: You're 'stuck' with her
description: Republican Presidential candidate Larry Elder warned Democrats that try to pass up Kamala Harris as an alternative to Biden could spell doom for the party in 2024.

title: The hidden cost of our huge problem with obesity
description: America’s increasing national obesity problem might be tied to taxpayer-funded food stamps that pay for unhealthy foods like soft drinks, snacks and candy.

title: Kelsea Ballerini, Harry Styles, Bebe Rexha are latest stars to be hit onstage by fan-thrown objects
description: Kelsea Ballerini is the latest example of musicians who have been hit with fan-thrown objects while performing. Harry Styles was hit in the face while performing in L.A. in November.

title: National Archives completes review of JFK assassination documents, 99% publicly available: White House
description: The National Archives has concluded its review of the classified documents in former President John F. Kennedy's assassination, and 99% of them are now available to the public.

title: Cruz 'accepts' Twitter user's proposal that would bar Democrat-passed bills from impacting GOP states
description: Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, discussed an idea on Twitter that would not allow states to receive benefits from a passed bill if both senators voted against it.

title: LA cop defies chief's orders to not post guns online, wields weapon in wedding photos
description: LAPD officer Toni McBride posted wedding photos with a gun, taking aim at demands from Chief Michel Moore, who she claims threatened to fire her over social media posts.

title: Biden’s unhinged ideas of Supreme Court and our Constitution
description: Biden muddles history to claim Supreme Court decisions reversed gains “we fought a war over in 1860." His distorted view has him concluding court is "not normal."

title: ‘Race-blind America’ advocate thrilled SCOTUS nixed affirmative action in college admissions
description: Kenny Xu is "ecstatic" that the Supreme Court rejected affirmative action in college admissions last week after he spent years pushing for a race-blind America.

title: Australian woman, dachshund mauled by bull terrier weeks before wedding day
description: An Australian woman was walking her miniature dachshund at a dog park when she and her dog were attacked by another dog, just seven weeks before her wedding.

title: California man with severe autism beats Rubik’s Cube world record: 'Exuberance in our hearts'
description: Max Park, 21, of California, who has severe autism, set the world record for the fastest time to solve a Rubik's Cube. His father, Schwan Park, told Fox News Digital of his son's story.

title: Trump draws massive crowd of at least 50K in small South Carolina town of 3,400: police
description: An estimated crowd of at least 50,000 attended former President Trump's rally in Pickens, South Carolina, a town of only 3,400 residents. The large event was Trump's second since March.

title: Vodka pickles to bratwurst: Americans reveal their Fourth of July cookout must-haves
description: Americans walking in the nation's capital shared their must-have food choices for their Independence Day barbecues to celebrate the country's birthday.

title: The tragedy of Philadelphia reveals a sad truth about our government
description: David Marcus details the drug addiction and homelessness in Kensington, Philadelphia, arguing the government is doing nothing about it.

title: AI public safety investment to grow to $71B by 2030 to ‘predict crime, natural disasters’: study
description: Public safety investments are predicted to jump from $9.3 billion in 2022 to $71 billion by 2030 to combat terrorism and crime while beefing up cybersecurity.

title: ChatGPT officiates Colorado wedding for Army soldier and bride before deployment
description: ChatGPT, a chatbot that can mimic human conversation, officiated a wedding in Colorado that was planned in just five days by an Army soldier and his now-bride.

title: Biden administration pushing to make AI woke, adhere to far-left agenda: watchdog
description: The Biden administration is seeking to use artificial intelligence to promote a woke ideology, according to research from a conservative watchdog group.

title: On this day in history, July 3, 1962, Tom Cruise is born, goes on to star in 'Born on the Fourth of July'
description: Tom Cruise, one of Hollywood's iconic leading men and the star of the "Mission Impossible" movies including other standout action films, was born on this day in history, July 3, 1962.

title: Hamburger casserole for dinner: Grandma's super simple recipe
description: This hamburger casserole recipe from Jill Bauer, the food and lifestyle expert behind JustJill.com, is simple and can be made in under an hour. This dish makes 12 servings.
